browserSupport.UPDATE_BROWSER_INTRO: You have reached the {{ name_key }} immunization site.

confirmationMessage.COMPLETION_MESSAGE: We have received your submission for {{ clientName }} and a staff member from {{ phuName }} will review this submission {{ time_to_process }}. We will be in touch if there are any questions.
confirmationMessage.REFERENCE_NUMBER_MESSAGE: Please keep this number for your records. You can also print or save a PDF copy of the information you have just submitted. If you have provided an email address, you will be notified once your submission has been received by your Public Health Unit and once your submission has been reviewed.

datepicker.DOB_ERROR: A valid date of birth is required.
datepicker.DATE_ERROR: You have entered an invalid date. Please use the format YYYY-MM-DD.

documentCapture.INSTRUCTIONS_0: Including documents helps your local Public Health Unit confirm the immunization records you have provided.
documentCapture.YELLOWCARD_PHOTO: A photo of a Yellow Card
documentCapture.INSTRUCTIONS_1: A document from your doctor displaying immunizations only. This can be a photo of the document.
documentCapture.INSTRUCTIONS_2: Any document that does not relate to immunization information.
documentCapture.UPLOAD_NOTES: These documents will only be used by your local Public Health Unit to confirm the immunization records you have provided. These files will not be added to the Provincial Immunization Resposity.
documentCapture.FILE_TYPES: Files must each be less than 5MB in size, and of the following file types: doc, docx, jpeg, jpg, pdf, png.
documentCapture.UPLOADER_ERROR: There was and error uploading the document.
documentCapture.UPLOADER_ERROR_QUEUE_LIMIT: You have exceeded the upload limit of 2 files. Please remove some files and retry.
documentCapture.UPLOADER_ERROR_FILE_TYPE: You have selected an invalid file type.
documentCapture.UPLOADER_ERROR_FILE_SIZE: You have attempted to upload a file that is too big. Maximum file size is 5MB
documentCapture.UPLOADER_ERROR_FILE_DUPLICATE: You can't add the same file twice.

welcomeAuthSubmitterModal.IMMUNIZATION_AUTH_SUBMISSION_LABEL: Who are you entering an Ontario Immunization ID and PIN for?

welcomeHelpModal.OIID_PIN_LABEL: What are the Ontario Immunization ID and PIN?
welcomeHelpModal.LOGIN_OIID: An Ontario Immunization ID is a ten digit number that uniquely identifies each person in the provincial immunization repository.
welcomeHelpModal.LOGIN_PIN: A patient's PIN is a six digit number that protects the confidentiality of immunization information.
welcomeHelpModal.OIID_TOOLTIP_1: Your Ontario Immunization ID may be found on a letter sent from
welcomeHelpModal.OIID_TOOLTIP_2: . If you do not have this code from your Health Unit, please contact
welcomeHelpModal.PIN_TOOLTIP_1: The PIN can be retrieved by contacting

welcomeLandingPage.PHU_MESSAGE: Use this site to view and update your immunization record.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_UL: Why should I use this site?
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_1: It’s an online alternative to paper immunization records.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_2: It allows Ontarians to securely keep track of their families’ immunization records.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_3: It allows families to report their child’s immunization records to their local public health unit, as required by the
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_BULLET_2: Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014 (CCEYA).
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_4: Public health units review immunization records to ensure schoolchildren are up to date with their immunizations. This helps to protect children and adolescents from serious diseases that can easily be spread in schools and throughout our communities.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_3: You may also need your immunization record for:
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_4: How do I use this site?
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_5: Every time you or your child gets a vaccine, record it here to keep track of your records and to report the vaccines to your local public health unit.
welcomeLandingPage.SCHEDULE_RATIONALE: Protection against the diseases in italics is required for school attendance under the Immunization School Pupils Act. NOTE**Children born on or after January 1, 2010 also need to be immunized against Varicella.

welcomeLogin.AUTH_LABEL: An Ontario Immunization ID and PIN let you do more, faster!
welcomeLogin.AUTH_BULLET_2: Check for needed and upcoming immunizations
welcomeLogin.AUTH_BULLET_4: Avoid re-entering immunizations and personal information already on file.

welcomeSubmitterModal.IMMUNIZATION_SUBMISSION_LABEL: Who are you submitting immunizations for?

yellowCardDisplay.NO_IMMS:
No immunization records found in the Provincial Repository.
Once immunization has been submitted and reviewed by your Public Health Unit they will appear here as a yellow card.

yellowCardRecommendations.HEADING: Immunizations Needed
yellowCardRecommendations.INTRO: As recommended by the Ontario Immunization Schedule you need immunizations to be protected against the following diseases:
yellowCardRecommendations.NOTE: Note: Immunizations needed may change if additional immunization information is submitted.
yellowCardRecommendations.FOR_MORE_INFO: For more information please visit Ontario’s Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care Immunization page.
yellowCardRecommendations.PRINT_BUTTON: Printable PDF Version of Immunization Record
yellowCardRecommendations.YC_CAVEAT: The information in the record above was pulled from the Ontario Immunization Repository. Recently submitted immunizations take time to be reviewed and might not be shown on this yellow card.
